docs.lead_paragraph: The cash-and-stock deal includes the assumption of $500 million in debt and would bolster Centene’s presence in the Western United States.

headline.main: Centene to Acquire Its Managed Care Rival Health Net for $6.8 Billion

docs.snippet: The cash-and-stock deal includes the assumption of $500 million in debt and would bolster Centene’s presence in the Western United States.

docs.lead_paragraph: The unemployment rate fell to its lowest in seven years, but that was driven largely by an exodus of people from the work force.

headline.main: U.S. Economy Adds 223,000 Jobs; Unemployment at 5.3%
headline.print_headline: Jobless Rate Fell in June, With Wages Staying Flat

docs.abstract: Labor Dept reports unemployment rate fell to 5.3 percent in June as economy added 223,000 jobs; level is lowest in seven years, but other economic indicators paint grayer picture of labor market in which wages have stagnated.
docs.snippet: The unemployment rate fell to its lowest in seven years, but that was driven largely by an exodus of people from the work force.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S health insurer Aetna Inc is nearing an agreement to buy rival Humana Inc for about $34 billion in a cash and stock deal, people familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A judge set bail on Thursday at $18 million in a Medicare fraud case for a doctor who has also been accused of bribery and political corruption for giving lavish gifts to U.S. Senator Robert Menendez, his attorney said.

headline.main: Bail Set for Florida Doctor Tied to Senator Menendez Corruption Case
headline.print_headline: Bail Set for Florida Doctor Tied to Senator Menendez Corruption Case

docs.snippet: A judge set bail on Thursday at $18 million in a Medicare fraud case for a doctor who has also been accused of bribery and political corruption for giving lavish gifts to U.S. Senator Robert Menendez, his attorney said.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. health insurer Cigna Corp has had its first meetings with competitor Anthem Inc after it rebuffed Anthem's $47 billion merger proposal last month, a person familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Anthem, Cigna in New Round of Talks: Source

docs.lead_paragraph: Centene has jumped into the mix of managed-care companies scrambling to bulk up as the health care overhaul changes their business with a $6.3-billion bid for fellow insurer Health Net.

headline.print_headline: Centene Makes $6.3B Bid for Fellow Insurer Health Net

docs.lead_paragraph: Scott M. Stringer, New York City’s comptroller, said misuse of an arcane system allowed agencies to circumvent contract regulations and restricted oversight of vendors with integrity and performance issues.

headline.main: New York Comptroller Faults Payment System in 39 City Agencies
headline.print_headline: Comptroller Faults Payment System in 39 City Agencies

docs.abstract: New York City Comptroller Scott M Stringer finds widespread misuse by several city agencies of arcane payment method that may have circumvented competitive bidding process on some expenditures.
docs.snippet: Scott M. Stringer, New York City’s comptroller, said misuse of an arcane system allowed agencies to circumvent contract regulations and restricted oversight of vendors with integrity and performance issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a visit to Tennessee, the president called for expanding health care access in mostly Republican-controlled states that have previously resisted parts of the law.

headline.main: Obama Takes Health Care Momentum Into G.O.P. Territory
headline.print_headline: With Law Upheld, Obama Tries to Win G.O.P. Converts

docs.abstract: Pres Obama travels to Tennessee to begin lobbying states that have resisted parts of his Affordable Care Act to expand care to more of their poor residents; visit comes days after Supreme Court hands victory to health care law for second time.
docs.snippet: In a visit to Tennessee, the president called for expanding health care access in mostly Republican-controlled states that have previously resisted parts of the law.

docs.lead_paragraph: The move against a sale to Electrolux is the latest sign of tougher antitrust scrutiny in Washington.

headline.main: Justice Department Sues to Block G.E. Appliance Deal

docs.abstract: DealBook Online; Justice Department files lawsuit to block General Electric's $3.3 billion sale of its home appliance unit to Electrolux of Sweden, citing antitrust concern.
docs.snippet: The move against a sale to Electrolux is the latest sign of tougher antitrust scrutiny in Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: Four executives of leading health care organizations are members of the board of the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, which is engaged in a worldwide campaign to thwart antismoking laws.

headline.main: U.S. Chamber Fights Smoking Laws While Hospitals and Insurers Sit on Its Board
headline.print_headline: Dissonance in Mission of Chamber on Tobacco

docs.abstract: United States Chamber of Commerce's global campaign to thwart antismoking laws presents challenge for many members of organization, especially hospitals and health insurers; four executives of prominent health care organizations are members of chamber's board.
docs.snippet: Four executives of leading health care organizations are members of the board of the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, which is engaged in a worldwide campaign to thwart antismoking laws.
